page.title: 12Customs Around Inverbervie
page.content: In our area when a couple are getting {married}it is customary to{blacken } them. Usually they will be chased by friends and captured then blackened, with oil, treacle or shoe polish. Then they are put on a vehicle and driven around the streets, taken down to the river and thrown in. Quite a number of people turn out to see a wedding because the bride or groom, or both, are usually well known in the area. When weddings take place in this area the brides' father usually throws coins onto the road. This is what the children have been waiting for. They make a mad scramble for as many as they can collect.
